First example of modal editor

This version of the Editor allows you to add, edit and remove rows by using a modal.

Select a row and click the "Edit" button if you want to make changes in the given row. "Delete" button works the same way.

For more explain see our documentation about editor.

Second example of modal editor

Second example is showing that you can use editor multipie times.

You only have to change id and data/aria attributes of modals.

Extended columns - Modal Editor

With our Table Editor plugin you can easily have more/less column in Table Editor with Modals than default example (6). Only what you have to do this:

  • Add new (or delete old one) th in thead.
  • Add new (or delete old one) td to each tr in tbody.
  • Add new (or delete old one) inputs in modalAdd and modalEdit.

Seven columns

0 row selected

Add new form

Add

Edit form

Delete
